A smart umbrella that monitors and adjusts its shape and size based on the weather conditions. This umbrella can detect changes in humidity, temperature, and wind speed, and can adjust its shape and size accordingly to provide the best protection from the elements. It can also be controlled remotely through a smartphone app, allowing users to adjust its settings and receive notifications when the weather changes.

An umbrella with a built-in water purification system. This umbrella can collect and filter rainwater, providing clean drinking water for users on the go. The system can be powered by a small solar panel or a rechargeable battery, making it a reliable source of clean water in areas where access to clean water is limited.

A glow-in-the-dark umbrella that provides safety and visibility in low-light conditions. This umbrella can be charged through a USB port and will glow brightly in the dark, making it easier for users to see and be seen in low-light environments. It can also have reflective strips to increase visibility from a distance.

An umbrella with a built-in speaker system. This umbrella can have a small speaker system that can play music or provide weather updates, making it a fun and convenient accessory for outdoor activities. It can also have a wireless Bluetooth connection, allowing users to connect their smartphones and stream music directly to the umbrella.

An umbrella with a built-in plant pot. This umbrella can have a small planter built into its handle, allowing users to carry a small plant or herb with them wherever they go. The planter can be made of a waterproof material, ensuring that the plant stays hydrated and healthy even in rainy conditions. This umbrella can also have a built-in irrigation system, automatically watering the plant as needed.
